content.description: Sit start on crimps, with rock slab behind you, traverse right into a large jug, match it, and then move straight up through crimps to the lip of the boulder.
content.protection: 2-3 pads. The climb traverses over a rocky landing.
content.location: On the right side of The Vine boulder. This climb traverses right over a large detached block.

content.description: Sit start at the base of the crack with a variety of foot options below, layback a move or two up to the obvious edge at ~waist height, match up here and make one long move up to the lip of the boulder. Match again, bring your feet up to the edge, and then rock on over the lip.
content.location: The start of this climb is in the middle of the Vine boulder, starting below an obvious edge at the base of the crack that moves up to the clearly distinguishable edge.

content.description: Start on ~waist high edge, with good feet, pull on and make one long deadpoint to the lip of the boulder. Match up on the lip, get high feet, and rock over the lip.
content.location: This climb starts on the left side of The Vine boulder, starting just to the left of On the Vine and just to the right of the tree stump. Starts at the smaller edge and goes straight up.

content.description: The Vine Boulder is a short ledge above the Jolly Rancher Boulder and near the Little Tomato.  The Vine does a great volume of climbs, but it does host a few short direct lines and an incredibly fun, if not also short, traverse problem (Ripe).
